model

Class imgR

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.imgR
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<imgR>

    public class imgR
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<imgR>, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    imgR is a reference point of an image. It dosen't really store the image physically
    Author:
    Ran Sa, Jami Nicastro
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • imgR

        public imgR(java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.String date,
            java.nio.file.Path p)
        The constructor that initialize the imgR. also initialize a taglist which contains all the tags
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the photo in a string
        date - The date of the image in a string format
        p - The physical path of the image in a string

    • Method Detail

      • getCopied

        public boolean getCopied()
        Check if the certain photo is copied
        Returns:
        true if it is copied, false if it is not

      • setCopied

        public void setCopied(boolean b)
        Change the iscopied value of the image, change to true means this image is copied, false means it is not
        Parameters:
        b - the iscopied value user wants to set to

      • setCaption

        public int setCaption(java.lang.String c,
                      boolean b)
        Set the caption field of the image
        Parameters:
        c - the string value of the caption user wants to set to
        b - True if user wants to set the value to the input string c, False if the suer just want to test to see if this caption is valid
        Returns:
        Return 1 if the caption is valid/set. Return -1 if the caption has not been changed.
